articles.summary: Armenia has procured significant defence equipment from India, including artillery guns, multi-barrel rocket launchers, air defence system, sniper rifles, weapons locating radars, anti-drone weapons.

articles.summary: Feasibility trials are complete and the team, comprising individuals from AIIMS, IIT Delhi, IHFC, and NCPOR plans to build its own medical-grade robot in the next phase.

articles.summary: Kunal Arya’s electric scooter stuttered when he first tried to zip down the Hisar roads in 2019. India was yet

articles.summary: Amid rising cases of digital frauds, the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has proposed compensating up to ₹25,000 to customers

articles.title: ‘Became so violent…’: Ravneet Singh Bittu recalls Rahul Gandhi's ‘traitor’ barb at Parliament
articles.summary: The confrontation took place on Wednesday morning near Parliament’s Makar Dwar, the main entrance to the new Parliament building.

articles.title: Domestic and foreign investors to get equal tax benefits on data centres: Union minister Ashwini Vaishnaw
articles.summary: Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said domestic and foreign companies will now receive equal tax benefits for data centres, providing relief to local players. The clarification follows concerns over previous advantages for global cloud providers. He added that data centres are crucial for India’s AI transition and will support rapid industry growth.

articles.title: India-US interim trade deal to boost access to advanced GPUs, data centre equipment
articles.summary: Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said India and the US are finalising an interim trade framework that will boost access to GPUs and data centre equipment. This agreement is expected to create opportunities for startups, service providers, and the wider AI ecosystem. Data centres are projected to drive major growth and investment.

articles.title: Ride hailing app services partially impacted as drivers go on strike
articles.summary: Ride-hailing apps such as Ola, Uber and Rapido faced sporadic disruption on Saturday as drivers staged a partial strike in several cities. The Telangana Gig and Platform Workers Union called the “breakdown” to protest rules and practices of app-based transport firms. The union demanded minimum base fares and regulatory changes.

articles.title: Operation Cyber Hawk 3.0: Over 500 apprehended in Delhi Police's cyber crackdown
articles.summary: Operation Cyber Hawk 3.0 targets organised cyber fraud networks operating across multiple digital platforms. The action involves advanced technical analysis, real-time intelligence inputs, financial trail tracking and coordinated field operations to identify and dismantle cybercrime syndicates.

articles.title: Uber, Ola, Rapido driver unions call for strike in Delhi, Mumbai: All that happened so far
articles.summary: The call for the strike is led by the Telangana Gig and Platform Workers Union. Per the Maharashtra Kamgar Sabha, the strike is being organised in protest against the “illegal” bike taxi services and the “arbitrary” fare policies followed by ride aggregators like Ola, Uber, and Rapido, besides other issues.

articles.title: Delhi: Gig workers' delegation meets Rahul Gandhi, asserts need for legislation
articles.summary: A delegation of transport and delivery gig workers met the Leader of Opposition in Lok Sabha, Rahul Gandhi, to discuss the need for legislation from the Centre and implementations of regulations in Congress-ruled states, the Telangana Gig And Platform Workers Union's Founder President said.

articles.title: IAMAI flags rushed DPDP rollout
articles.summary: The Internet and Mobile Association of India has asked the government to slow enforcement of the Digital Personal Data Protection framework, warning rushed timelines could disrupt businesses. It said companies were promised an 18-month transition but may now get far less. IAMAI cautioned this could create operational, legal and compliance risks across the digital ecosystem.

articles.title: Fractal Analytics raises Rs 1,248 crore from anchor investors ahead of IPO
articles.summary: The AI firm allocated 1.3 crore equity shares to 52 anchor investors at Rs 900 per share. Domestic mutual funds accounted for nearly 38% of the anchor book. The IPO has been priced at a discount of about 26% to its most recent private market valuation in July 2025. Noting that the company could have raised capital at a higher valuation in private markets, Fractal Analytics cofounder and group CEO Srikanth Velamakanni said public market investors often evaluate AI companies differently from speci

articles.title: India’s largest pre-silicon chip validation facility opens at C-DAC Bengaluru
articles.summary: The Centre for Development of Advanced Computing (C-DAC) has launched the PRITVI-ACE pre-silicon validation facility in Bengaluru to strengthen India’s semiconductor design ecosystem. According to C-DAC officials, it enables end-to-end validation, from individual IP blocks to full system-level designs, well before silicon fabrication. These include early operating system boot, firmware and driver validation, protocol compliance checks and performance benchmarking at near-real-world speeds.

articles.title: PhysicsWallah raises stake in Kamya Yoga & Wellness to 41% with Rs 1.5 crore investment
articles.summary: Noida-based edtech firm PhysicsWallah (PW) will raise its stake in Kay Lifestyle and Wellness to 41.18% by subscribing to 300 seed CCPS for Rs 1.5 crore. PW currently holds 28.57% and could increase its share up to 50% under the agreement. The investment is expected to complete by February 2027.

articles.title: Tech shares, bitcoin stabilise after a week of severe declines
articles.summary: Indian markets are set for a positive start. Technology stocks are showing signs of recovery after a tough week. Bitcoin's sharp fall appears to have paused, offering some relief. Investors are watching these developments closely. Global markets are also experiencing mixed movements. This could influence trading trends in the coming sessions.

articles.title: PB Fintech shelves plan to raise funds for acquisitions via QIP
articles.summary: In a regulatory filing to stock exchanges on Friday, the company said its management and board are not considering a qualified institutional placement (QIP), refuting a media report.

articles.title: Tesla is training its AI technology in China: Report
articles.summary: ​Tesla ⁠is operating an artificial ‌intelligence ‌training ‌centre in China focusing on local ​application ​and assisted ‌driving, ‍Chinese ‍media outlet Cailianshe reported ‌on Friday, citing the company's ‍Vice President ‍Tao ⁠Lin.

articles.title: PhonePe takes its diversification to Dalal Street
articles.summary: Payments still power scale. But its updated draft red herring prospectus (UDRHP) shows that PhonePe’s monetisation story lies elsewhere.

articles.title: Pine Labs receives GST tax demand of Rs 37.33 crore
articles.summary: This follows an appeal order issued by the Office of the Joint Commissioner of Commercial Taxes (Appeals)-4, Bengaluru. Pine Labs plans to file an appeal against the Joint Commissioner’s order before the Customs, Excise and Service Tax Appellate Tribunal (CESTAT).

articles.title: Intel, AMD notify customers in China of lengthy waits for CPUs
articles.summary: The supply constraints have driven up prices for Intel's ⁠server products in China by more than 10% generally, although pricing varies by customer contract, according to one of the people.

articles.title: Social media's role must be assessed from lens of societal harmony, trust: Vaishnaw
articles.summary: Noting that social media is now among the most important modes of information and outreach, the minister said while it offers benefits such as learning, its broader impact must be clearly assessed to ensure they add value to society, their content is trustworthy and the platforms do their due diligence.

articles.title: Nixi CEO says 400+ banks moved to .bank.in to comply with RBI mandate
articles.summary: Over 400 banks in India have shifted their websites to the secure ‘.bank.in’ domain, following an RBI mandate to improve cybersecurity and prevent phishing. The move helps customers identify legitimate banking sites. India is also preparing for ICANN’s gTLD round, allowing organisations to apply for new domain extensions.

articles.title: India-US Technology Forum sets sight on $500 billion trade target: Nasscom
articles.summary: The Nasscom US CEO Forum met in Washington DC to boost India-US technology and trade. The goal is USD 500 billion in bilateral trade. Discussions covered innovation, AI, and job creation. Indian tech firms contribute significantly to the US economy. Energy security was a key focus. The forum aims for co-creation in technology.

articles.title: Union minister Amit Shah launches 'Bharat Taxi' app
articles.summary: The Union Home and Cooperation Minister Amit Shah on Thursday launched the 'Bharat Taxi' App, aimed at strengthening cooperative participation and enhancing welfare measures for taxi drivers across the country.

articles.title: US software stocks stabilise after bruising selloff on AI disruption fears
articles.summary: Software and data services stocks stabilized on Thursday after a bruising selloff, as investors looked ‍for clues on whether fast-advancing artificial ​intelligence tools are starting to dent demand for traditional software and subscription businesses.

articles.title: 'India an indispensable partner for Europe; is now necessary to have,' Greek Defence Minister says
articles.summary: Greek Defence Minister Nikos Dendias declared India an indispensable partner for Europe, highlighting its growing strategic and economic significance. Speaking at the India-EU Forum 2026, he expressed strong support for the proposed EU-India Free Trade Agreement, anticipating substantial mutual benefits. The forum concluded after two days of discussions on enhancing India-EU cooperation across various domains.

articles.title: India, US seal interim trade pact framework
articles.summary: India-US trade deal: India's exports of about $44 billion to the US will enter the American market at zero reciprocal tariffs under the first phase of the BTA, which is expected to be signed by mid-March. This will include spices, tea, coffee, copra, coconut oil, certain nuts, banana, guava, mango, bakery goods, and home decor.

articles.title: Tariff reset by US lifts India's global trade competitive edge
articles.summary: India and the US have inked an interim trade deal, paving the way for duty-free exports across numerous sectors, including textiles, leather, and aviation. Global aerospace giants Boeing and Airbus are eyeing India as a major foreign Original Equipment Manufacturer base for aircraft components, signaling significant growth potential and excitement for the bilateral partnership.

articles.title: India opens farm market: Duty-free DDGS, sorghum to boost poultry; nut duty cut may spur demand
articles.summary: There's no clarity yet on the level of import duty reduction by India on US tree nuts comprising walnuts, almonds and pistachios. The domestic industry however believes that any duty cut would lead to lower prices, driving consumption among Indian consumers.

articles.title: Safe harbour move to help India outcompete peers in component warehousing, supply chain: Officials
articles.summary: The budget proposed a revamped safe harbour regime for component warehousing linked to manufacturing, fixing taxable margins at 2% which would result in an effective tax rate of about 0.7%.

articles.title: India's apparel, footwear, chemicals to get a major export boost in US under bilateral trade pact
articles.summary: India's exports to the US will see a significant boost. An interim trade agreement between India and the US will reduce import duties on several Indian goods. This move is expected to greatly benefit labour-intensive sectors like apparel, footwear, and home decor. The US has removed punitive duties, and reciprocal tariffs are set to decrease.

articles.title: ICT products from US need of the hour in India: Piyush Goyal
articles.summary: Under the interim trade agreement between India and the US, New Delhi has agreed to address long-standing barriers to the trade in US medical devices; eliminate restrictive import licensing procedures that delay market access for, or impose quantitative restrictions on, US Information and Communication Technology (ICT) goods.

articles.title: India US Interim Agreement framework to support MSMEs integration into global value chains: FM Sitharaman
articles.summary: India US trade deal: As part of the framework announced last night, both countries will reduce import duties on a number of goods to boost two-way trade.

articles.title: US wines, spirits, dry fruits to enter India at lower or zero duty under trade pact
articles.summary: India-US trade deal: India and the US on Saturday announced that they have reached a framework for the first phase of the bilateral trade agreement under which both sides will reduce import duties on a number of goods to boost two-way trade.

articles.title: Piyush Goyal says, India's exports of USD 44 bn to US to get zero reciprocal tariffs under trade pact
articles.summary: India and the US will sign a trade pact by mid-March. Around USD 44 billion of Indian exports will enter the US duty-free. This agreement will boost trade and benefit Indian industries. It aims to achieve USD 500 billion in bilateral trade by 2030. The pact opens opportunities for MSMEs, farmers, and fishermen.

articles.title: India-US trade agreement along with other FTAs positive for Indian economy: SBI Chairman
articles.summary: State Bank of India Chairman CS Setty views India-US trade deals and other FTAs as highly beneficial for India's economy. He notes the absence of tariff overhang opens global supply chain opportunities. The Reserve Bank of India's decision to maintain the repo rate was anticipated.

articles.title: Interests of Indian farmers fully protected under Indo-US trade deal, asserts Shivraj Singh Chouhan
articles.summary: Union Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan stated that Indian farmers' interests are fully protected under the Indo-US trade deal. He dismissed opposition claims that the pact will harm cultivators. Chouhan highlighted that the agreement safeguards basmati, rice, spices, and textiles. He added that increased exports will boost farmers' incomes.

articles.title: Vaishnaw: India in close talks with US on electronics, IP
articles.summary: India and the US have finalized an interim trade agreement. This deal focuses on electronics and intellectual property. It aims to boost trade in technology products like GPUs. Data centers are expected to see significant growth. This will create new opportunities for Indian startups and service providers. Investments in this sector are projected to exceed 200 billion dollars.

articles.title: India-US interim trade pact framework sends strong signal of confidence to global investors: Industry
articles.summary: India and the US have reached a framework for an interim trade agreement, set to boost bilateral trade by reducing import duties on various goods. This move is seen by India Inc as a strong signal of confidence to global investors, enhancing competitiveness and supply chain resilience.

articles.title: What India gave the US to seal a $500 billion interim trade deal
articles.summary: India has granted US selective market access under a new trade agreement, allowing duty-free entry for products like animal feed, certain wines, and computer components. This calibrated approach aims to boost trade and economic growth while carefully protecting domestic industries and ensuring benefits for its citizens.

articles.title: Piyush Goyal says farmers safe in US trade deal; India didn't budge on its red lines
articles.summary: India has secured its farmers' interests in the new trade agreement with the US, with Trade Minister Piyush Goyal confirming no genetically modified products will be imported. The deal offers zero additional tariffs on numerous Indian agricultural exports to the US, aiming to boost farmer incomes and strengthen exports.

articles.title: Zero duty, open market: Goyal says US doors open tariff free for India’s farmers and pharma
articles.summary: India has achieved zero-duty access for numerous exports to the United States. This interim trade deal benefits agriculture, pharmaceuticals, and manufactured goods. Farmers' interests are protected as key agricultural products like tea, spices, and coffee will face no US import tariffs. Pharmaceutical exports worth billions will also be duty-free. This agreement highlights India's export strength and future market access.

articles.title: India-US trade deal: America has stopped short of Indian red lines
articles.summary: US and India have agreed to an interim trade framework. This deal marks a significant step forward in bilateral economic ties. India has successfully protected its crucial agriculture and dairy sectors. The agreement focuses on specific tariff reductions and market access in non-sensitive areas. Further negotiations will continue towards a comprehensive trade agreement.

articles.title: From wine to walnuts: India–US trade deal set to make American imports cheaper
articles.summary: India-US trade deal: India and the United States have agreed to an interim trade deal. Tariffs on many US food and farm goods will be reduced in India. The US will also lower duties on Indian products. Both nations aim to ease trade issues and boost market access. Negotiations for a broader trade pact will continue.

articles.title: Bihar to form milk producers' committees in all villages in 2 yrs to boost dairy production: Nitish Kumar
articles.summary: Bihar government is establishing milk producer committees in all villages to boost dairy production, with plans to set up outlets in remaining villages within two years. The initiative aims to ensure fair prices for rearers and create employment opportunities, strengthening the rural economy. Sudha Milk outlets will be prioritized for JEEViKA 'didis' under the Saat Nischay-3 program.

articles.title: India–US trade deal to boost trade momentum, say FICCI, PHDCCI
articles.summary: India and the United States have announced a framework for an interim trade agreement. This deal aims to expand market access for exporters in both nations. It addresses tariffs and regulatory barriers, fostering collaboration in manufacturing and technology. India will gain tariff-free access to certain US aircraft and parts.

articles.title: US tariff cut brings joy to handicraft traders, boosts export hopes
articles.summary: Sambhal's handicraft traders are experiencing renewed optimism following a significant reduction in US import tariffs. This move is expected to boost exports of artisanal products. The tariff cut from 50 percent to 18 percent is anticipated to revive international demand and clear suspended orders. This development signals a positive turn for the industry, promising growth and increased trade opportunities.

articles.title: India-US trade deal to boost exports, jobs; farmers’ interests safeguarded: Rajnath Singh
articles.summary: India and the United States have reached an interim trade agreement framework. This deal will boost exports and create jobs. Farmers' interests are protected. The US will reduce tariffs on Indian goods. India will lower tariffs on US industrial and agricultural products. India also plans to buy significant US energy and aircraft products over five years.

articles.title: US–India $500 billion interim trade framework: Read the full formal text
articles.summary: The United States and India have announced a framework for an Interim Trade Agreement, building on their commitment to a broader Bilateral Trade Agreement. This agreement includes tariff reductions on U.S. goods by India and reciprocal tariffs by the U.S. on Indian products, alongside commitments to address non-tariff barriers and enhance supply chain resilience.

articles.title: India–US Trade Deal: Big promises, quiet protections — what really happens to agriculture?
articles.summary: India and the United States have agreed on a framework for an interim trade deal. This agreement places agriculture at the forefront. The US anticipates greater access for its farm products in India. However, India has assured protection for its crucial agricultural sectors. This includes dairy, grains, and vegetables. The deal aims for mutual benefit and strengthens India's self-reliance.

articles.title: India, US agree on interim trade pact framework with 18% tariff on India
articles.summary: India and the United States have agreed on a framework for an interim trade pact that will cut tariffs on Indian-origin goods to 18% from 50% and pave the way for a comprehensive Bilateral Trade Agreement covering goods, services, supply chains and digital trade. The two sides will also address non-tariff barriers and set rules of origin to ensure benefits largely accrue to both countries.

articles.title: From drugs to aircraft parts, what India gets under the $500 billion US trade deal
articles.summary: India and the US have agreed on an interim trade framework, improving Indian market access for pharmaceuticals, gems, diamonds, and aircraft parts. This reciprocal agreement aims for balanced trade, resilient supply chains, and sets the stage for a broader Bilateral Trade Agreement, focusing on technology and digital trade.

articles.title: India-US trade pact to expand market access for American farmers, producers: USTR
articles.summary: The United States Trade Representative (USTR) said the India-US interim trade agreement will expand access for American farmers and producers to one of the world’s largest markets. It said India has committed to eliminating or lowering tariffs on all US industrial goods and a wide range of agricultural products, while also addressing long-standing non-tariff barriers.

articles.title: Addressing non-tariff barriers to tech cooperation, BTA focuses on facilitating trade: Piyush Goyal
articles.summary: India and the United States have signed a significant trade deal. This agreement will ease market access and reduce trade barriers. Cooperation in advanced technologies, including GPUs, will expand. Indian exporters will benefit from reduced tariffs. The deal aims to boost bilateral trade and strengthen economic ties between the two nations.

articles.title: No duty concessions on sensitive grains, fruits, dairy, meat under trade pact with US: Piyush Goyal
articles.summary: Union Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal said the India-US trade agreement framework protects key farm sectors to safeguard domestic interests. He said dairy, fruits, vegetables, spices and grains have been kept protected to support local agriculture and strengthen the country’s push towards self-reliance.

articles.title: India gets duty free access to US aircraft, aircraft parts under BTA
articles.summary: India-US trade deal: India will get tariff-free access to certain aircraft and aircraft parts from the US under the framework for an interim bilateral trade agreement announced by both countries, according to a joint statement. India will also receive a preferential tariff rate quota for auto parts and negotiated outcomes on generic pharmaceuticals and ingredients, while both sides committed to providing preferential market access in sectors of mutual interest.

articles.title: India-US interim trade deal framework: Key highlights
articles.summary: India-US interim trade deal: The United States and India have agreed on an interim trade pact framework, aiming to lower tariffs and boost economic cooperation. This deal includes India reducing duties on U.S. industrial and farm goods, while the U.S. will apply reciprocal tariffs on certain Indian products, with plans for future removal. Both nations also commit to strengthening supply chains and digital trade.

articles.title: India-US trade deal to open $30 trillion market for Indian exporters: Piyush Goyal
articles.summary: India-US trade deal: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal said the India-US interim trade agreement framework will give Indian exporters access to a USD 30 trillion market, benefiting MSMEs, farmers and fishermen and creating lakhs of jobs for women and youth. He stated, "Under the decisive leadership of PM @NarendraModi ji, India has reached a framework for an Interim Agreement with the US. This will open a USD 30 trillion market for Indian exporters, especially MSMEs, farmers and fisher

articles.title: India-US interim trade deal framework unveiled: $500 billion worth of goods purchase on cards
articles.summary: India-US Trade Deal: India and the United States have established a trade deal framework, significantly lowering tariffs and boosting economic cooperation. The agreement includes India's commitment to purchase $500 billion in U.S. goods over five years, with further negotiations planned for a comprehensive bilateral trade agreement.

articles.title: India negotiating new FTAs
articles.summary: FTA: India is actively participating in regional and plurilateral platforms to support diversified and sustainable supply chains, including the Indo-Pacific Economic Framework for Prosperity (IPEF), minister Jitin Prasada said.

articles.title: Mcap of 8 of top 10 valued firms surges by whopping Rs 4.55 lakh cr; Reliance biggest winner
articles.summary: The combined market valuation of eight of the top 10 valued firms jumped by a whopping Rs 4.55 lakh crore last week, with Reliance Industries emerging as the biggest winner, in line with a remarkable rally in equities.

articles.title: High valuations, narrow AI rally cap upside for US equities in the medium term: Anand Rathi
articles.summary: After a strong rally driven largely by a few AI-focused stocks, US equities are facing concerns around high valuations and narrow market leadership. Anand Rathi believes the long-term outlook for US markets remains positive, but broad-based gains may be limited in the medium term, prompting investors to moderate return expectations and look for better risk-reward opportunities globally.

articles.title: Alphabet-backed Aye Finance raises Rs 454 crore from anchor investors ahead of IPO; Goldman Sachs key investor
articles.summary: Alphabet-backed Aye Finance has raised Rs 454 crore from anchor investors ahead of its Rs 1,010 crore IPO opening on February 9. The anchor book includes Goldman Sachs and other global institutions, signalling strong confidence in the MSME-focused NBFC’s scalable and profitable lending model.

articles.title: India's NSE to set up unit for proposed national coal trading exchange
articles.summary: India's National Stock Exchange has approved a new unit to manage a national coal trading platform. This platform will allow electronic trading of physical coal using standardized contracts. It aims to address price inefficiencies and improve access for smaller participants. The exchange will facilitate physical delivery and potentially derivative products in the future.

articles.title: Iran's surging crypto activity draws US scrutiny
articles.summary: Crypto use in Iran is surging amid sanctions and currency collapse, prompting U.S. scrutiny of platforms for possible sanctions evasion, while researchers debate the scale of state-linked activity versus retail adoption as millions turn to digital assets nationwide economic strain.

articles.title: Investor angst turns to earnings after trade clouds clear
articles.summary: Indian stocks are navigating challenges despite trade agreements. Corporate earnings growth is lagging, and foreign investors are looking elsewhere. Recent AI advancements also impact tech giants. While trade deals offer some relief, the focus remains on strategic growth areas. Investors are cautiously optimistic about the Indian market's future.

articles.title: Where does the capex focus lie in Union Budget 2026?
articles.summary: Headline capex understates the Union Budget’s infrastructure push. Adjusting for equity infusions, state and private spending, and extra-budgetary resources shows effective Centre infrastructure spending rose 18% year-on-year, led by defence, transport, housing, and water, alongside PLI and targeted tax incentives.

articles.title: IPO calendar: 3 issues worth Rs 3,871 crore to open next week as Fractal, Aye Finance hit markets
articles.summary: India’s IPO market gears up for a busy week as three issues worth Rs 3,871 crore open between February 9 and 16. Fractal Analytics and Aye Finance lead the mainboard segment, while Marushika Technology adds momentum on the SME platform.

articles.title: Gold bounces back on softer dollar, US-Iran concerns; silver rebounds
articles.summary: Gold rebounded on Friday, poised for a weekly gain driven by bargain hunting, a weaker dollar, and ongoing U.S.-Iran talks. Silver also recovered from a recent low, though both metals are showing signs of entering a commodity bust phase. CME Group raised margin requirements amid heightened volatility.

articles.title: Dish TV India sinks deeper into losses in Q3 as subscription revenues continue to slide
articles.summary: Dish TV reported a net loss of approximately Rs 276 crore for Q3 FY26, sharply higher than the loss of around Rs 47 crore reported in the same quarter last year. The company reported exceptional items of around Rs 70 crore during the quarter, taking the loss before tax to about Rs 276 crore.

articles.title: Fractal Analytics raises Rs 1,249 crore from anchor investors ahead of IPO; Morgan Stanley, Goldman Sachs among key backers
articles.summary: Fractal Analytics raised Rs 1,249 crore from 52 anchor investors at Rs 900 per share ahead of its IPO opening February 9. Strong domestic and global institutional demand signals confidence in the AI analytics firm and growth prospects globally strong.

articles.title: RBI removes VRR cap, reshapes FPI debt limits to boost bond inflows
articles.summary: RBI scrapped the Rs 2.5 lakh crore VRR cap, folding it into FPI debt limits from April, boosting flexibility and ease of doing business while retaining safeguards on foreign ownership. Existing VRR investments shift to general limits, with gains expected.

articles.title: RBI issues draft rules for credit derivatives and total return swaps linked to corporate bonds
articles.summary: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has released draft rules for derivatives on credit indices and total return swaps (TRS) linked to corporate bonds.

articles.title: From churches to chatbots: How AI is fusing with religion
articles.summary: AI is beginning to shape how people practise faith, from pastors using custom GPTs for sermons to tools supporting spiritual growth and community life. Some worshippers turn to AI chatbots to seek meaning, forgiveness and moral guidance. However, academics and religious leaders warn of risks as AI enters belief and worship.

articles.title: Andhra to set up AI Living Labs Foundation; HQ in Amaravati
articles.summary: The AI Living Labs Foundation will provide shared graphics processing unit (GPU) computing resources, AI tools, curated datasets and sandboxes for workforce skilling, aligned with the state's objective of inclusive digital growth and its vision of enabling 'one AI-trained individual per family'.

articles.title: Research symposium at India AI Impact Summit draws world's AI minds
articles.summary: The Research Symposium on 'AI and its Impact', being organised as part of the India AI Impact Summit 2026, has received a strong response from the national and global research community, with over 250 submissions.

articles.title: Apple plans to allow external voice-controlled AI chatbots in CarPlay: Report
articles.summary: Apple is preparing ​to allow voice-controlled artificial intelligence apps ⁠from other companies in CarPlay. The change ‌represents a ‌strategic shift for Apple, which, until now, has only ‌allowed its own Siri assistant as a voice-control option.

articles.title: Indians show no urge to press buy button for AI PCs
articles.summary: Global demand for AI PCs is slowing faster than expected, and India is seeing a similar trend as buyers hesitate over higher prices. Gartner has cut its 2026 forecast, citing weak consumer interest and lack of compelling software. Hardware limits, especially memory shortages, are further holding back adoption.

articles.title: Net impact of AI on jobs positive, managing the transition to new tech a challenge: RBI
articles.summary: Amid widespread worries over the impact of artificial intelligence on jobs, Reserve Bank Deputy Governor Poonam Gupta on Friday said the net impact of the new technology on employment will be a positive one.

articles.title: Security concerns, scepticism bursting bubble of Moltbook, viral AI social forum
articles.summary: Moltbook is a new "social network" built exclusively for AI agents to make posts and interact with each other, and humans are invited to observe. Elon Musk said its launch ushered in the "very early stages of the singularity " - or when artificial intelligence could surpass human intelligence.

articles.title: AI data centres could spur Internet era-type job boom, says Nvidia’s Jensen Huang
articles.summary: The CEO of the AI major said AI infrastructure would create jobs across construction, supply chains, operations, and innovation, alongside direct employment. His comments follow the Union Budget 2026, which has extended tax holidays for data centre investments, a move expected to attract up to $200 billion into India

articles.title: Security concerns and scepticism are bursting the bubble of Moltbook, the viral AI social forum
articles.summary: A new social media platform called Moltbook has emerged, exclusively for AI agents. Humans can observe but not directly participate. This development has generated significant buzz, with some hailing it as a step towards the singularity. However, security researchers have uncovered critical vulnerabilities, raising alarms about data exposure and potential manipulation.

articles.title: IIT Madras & Unicorn India Ventures launch Rs 600-crore deeptech fund
articles.summary: IIT Madras and Unicorn India Ventures have launched a Rs 600-crore deeptech fund, with a Rs 400-crore greenshoe option, to support early-stage, IP-driven startups. The fund will back engineering-heavy firms in robotics, space, defence, semiconductors, and medical technology, investing Rs 8–10 crore in over 25 startups.

articles.title: How India is gearing up to power its AI ambitions
articles.summary: In the official pre-summit event to the India AI Impact Summit 2026, Hitachi Energy India will bring together stakeholders to deliberate on - Can our power grids fuel our AI ambitions?

articles.title: AI job fears trigger IT selloff; Unmesh Sharma sees opportunity for Indian IT, not doom
articles.summary: Indian technology stocks experienced a sharp decline following AI breakthroughs. However, an expert highlights that India's strength lies in AI implementation rather than core innovation. Electronics manufacturing services are identified as a multi-year growth sector. Investors are advised to navigate volatility with a focus on structural themes and disciplined positioning for future gains.

articles.title: School assembly news headlines Feb 4: Top national, international, sports, business update and thought of the day
articles.summary: India and the US finalized a significant trade deal, boosting the rupee and leading to discussions on oil procurement and tariff adjustments. Meanwhile, national headlines include political developments, a tragic incident involving a Bengaluru CEO, and aviation safety concerns. Internationally, Russia's assault on Ukraine continues, and Pakistan faces challenges with defense deals and internal security.

articles.title: Gujarat fake milk racket busted after nearly five years; detergent, urea used in production
articles.summary: The operation was busted as the Sabarkantha Local Crime Branch (LCB) raided Shree Satya Dairy Products, a local dairy production unit near Salal village in Prantij taluk.

articles.title: Ashwini Vaishnaw unveils Qualcomm's 2-nm chip, sets roadmap for Semicon 2.0
articles.summary: According to Ashwini Vaishnaw, India Semiconductor Mission 2.0 will prioritise indigenous chip design and attract ecosystem partners.

articles.title: Volkswagen Tayron R-Line Review: A driver-focused seven-seater with a sporty streak
articles.summary: With local assembly expected to keep prices competitive, the Volkswagen Tayron R-Line enters India as a premium three-row SUV that prioritises build quality, performance and driver engagement.

articles.title: Rising commodity costs to drive price hike in coming weeks: Tata Motors Passenger Vehicles MD & CEO
articles.summary: Tata Motors Passenger Vehicles Ltd (TMPVL) will hike prices in the "coming weeks" in the wake of rising commodity cost putting pressure, according to its Managing Director & CEO, Shailesh Chandra.

articles.title: Shree Cements eyes Q4FY26 volume rebound, plans aggressive RMC expansion
articles.summary: Shree Cements expects a strong rebound in cement volumes in the fourth quarter of the current financial year, aided by a pickup in infrastructure activity and higher government spending towards the fiscal yearend, the management said in a Q3 analyst concall.

articles.title: Why the ’90s ads stuck — and why today’s AI-era ads don’t
articles.summary: As artificial intelligence accelerates ad creation and shortens campaign cycles, India’s top creative leaders say something critical is being lost—time, shared viewing and emotional stickiness. From Vicco Turmeric to Kelvinator, they explain why advertising’s golden era still lives in public memory while today’s AI-era campaigns fade fast.

articles.title: Anthropic buys Super Bowl ads to slap OpenAI for selling ads in ChatGPT
articles.summary: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman was not amused, calling the Anthropic ad "deceptive" in a post on Wednesday on the social media platform X.

articles.title: Farmer outfits slam India-US trade deal, call for large-scale protests on Feb 12
articles.summary: SKM, AIKS and other farmer groups condemn the India-US trade deal, demand Piyush Goyal's resignation, and plan nationwide protests, including a February 12 general strike.

articles.title: RSS centenary: Volunteers run 1.3 lakh service activities across India, says Bhagwat
articles.summary: At the RSS centenary lecture series, Mohan Bhagwat emphasized social service, cultural identity, civic discipline, inclusive Hindu identity, and unity as keys to India's progress.

articles.title: Govt proposes 2% safe harbour tax regime for component warehousing under Budget reforms
articles.summary: India introduces a 2 percent safe harbour margin for component warehousing, aiming to boost global manufacturing appeal with predictable tax, reduced disputes, and enhanced supply-chain certainty.

articles.title: Fairfax Financial and Emirates NBD submit bids for IDBI Bank disinvestment: Sources
articles.summary: Fairfax Financial and Emirates NBD have submitted financial bids for IDBI Bank’s 60.7% stake divestment, with DIPAM now evaluating offers as Kotak Mahindra Bank opts out.

articles.title: Cyber insurance and rising digital threats: How businesses can manage risk
articles.summary: Indian firms are turning to cyber insurance for risks like data breaches. Experts urge proactive security and frequent policy reviews.

articles.title: AI data centres, not just power grids, are driving Hitachi Energy’s growth: CEO N Venu
articles.summary: Hitachi Energy sees AI-driven data centres reshaping power demand with sudden load spikes and complex grid requirements, opening up a sizeable opportunity across transmission equipment, digital solutions and grid services, according to Managing Director and CEO N Venu.

articles.title: Meet Pepita Seth, the British photographer who received Indian citizenship after 54 years
articles.summary: Seth, who has lived in India for more than five decades, applied for Indian citizenship in 2024 after completing 54 years of residence in the country.

articles.title: India-US interim trade deal to boost electronics, tech products and IP co-development, says Vaishnaw
articles.summary: Ashwini Vaishnaw announced India and US will boost technology trade, especially GPUs and data centers, with investments expected to exceed 200 billion dollars under the India AI mission.

articles.title: How US-India trade deal will affect imports, exports and industries, explains Piyush Goyal
articles.summary: Piyush Goyal outlined the India–US interim trade framework, promising zero duties on key imports, protection for sensitive sectors, and boosted exports, aiming for $500 billion bilateral trade.

articles.title: India-US trade deal to revitalise exports; marks an end to 'coldness': Carnelian Asset's Khemani
articles.summary: Vikas Khemani says the India-US interim trade framework ends a period of coldness, boosts pharma, and could open new sectors to the US market, reviving momentum in bilateral relations.

articles.title: No finality to 18% tariff, trust deficit remains: Ex-WTO envoy Dasgupta on India-US trade deal
articles.summary: Jayant Dasgupta warns that despite India and US announcing an interim trade framework and tariff rollback, major gaps and uncertainties remain, with legal and geopolitical risks threatening the deal.

articles.title: India–US trade deal could stabilise rupee, revive FPI flows, says Trust MF CIO Mihir Vora
articles.summary: The India–US interim trade agreement boosts rupee stability and foreign investment, expands India’s export market, and benefits sectors like textiles, chemicals, and pharmaceuticals, says Mihir Vora.

articles.title: India–US interim trade pact: What the joint statement says on tariffs
articles.summary: The US and India finalized a framework for an interim trade agreement, reducing tariffs and boosting market access, paving the way for a comprehensive US–India Bilateral Trade Agreement.

articles.title: India–US interim trade deal LIVE updates: Export surge to push trade to $500B in 5 years - Piyush Goyal
articles.summary: India–US interim trade deal LIVE updates: India and the United States announce an interim trade pact lowering tariffs, ending extra US duties on Indian goods, and boosting prospects for a full Bilateral Trade Agreement.

articles.title: India to shift to risk-based deposit insurance premiums from April 1
articles.summary: India will introduce risk-based deposit insurance premiums from April 2026, replacing flat rates to reward stronger banks, penalise weaker ones, and improve risk management overall.

articles.title: Icra sees 10-12% copper demand growth in India over next 2 years
articles.summary: Copper usage in India is surging, driven by rapid urbanisation, infrastructure development, and the green energy transition.

articles.title: Global uncertainty drives market volatility; India relatively stable: Emmer Capital CEO
articles.summary: Manishi Raychaudhuri, Chief Executive Officer, Emmer Capital Partners said India has remained relatively stable compared with other Asian markets. He sees opportunities in financials, materials, industrials, and selective consumer stocks, while remaining cautious on IT services due to AI disruption risks.

articles.title: Yunus administration fast-tracks Bangladesh-US trade pact ahead of polls, industry flags risks
articles.summary: Reports that the Yunus led interim administration signed a non-disclosure agreement with United States last year have added to the concern. If accurate, it means negotiation details cannot be publicly discussed.

articles.title: Exclusive: India-US trade deal leaves out wheat, rice, soya, dairy, say top govt sources
articles.summary: Government sources indicated that India has already committed to buying items from the US which are imported from other nations, which includes oil, gas, aircraft, laptops, smartphones, and goods for data centres.

articles.title: RBI MPC meet 2026 highlights | Should be looking at net borrowing figure, not gross, says Governor Sanjay Malhotra
articles.summary: RBI MPC meet 2026 LIVE: RBI MPC keeps repo rate at 5.25%, citing benign inflation and strong growth. Governor Sanjay Malhotra notes EU and US trade deals, but warns of rising geopolitical tensions.

articles.title: Government borrowing of ₹17.2 lakh crore to be completed in non-disruptive manner: Economic Affairs Secretary Anuradha Thakur
articles.summary: Talking about the Budget announcement related to Alternative Investment Funds (AIFs), Thakur said the industry's long-pending demand has been accommodated in this Budget.

articles.title: AIADMK revives loan waiver, expands welfare push as TN fiscal space comes into focus
articles.summary: AIADMK’s poll promises—education loan waiver, minority loans and transport subsidies—reignite debate on Tamil Nadu’s finances, with debt and deficit near FRBM limits ahead of elections.

articles.title: GCC expects FTA with India to reduce global uncertainty
articles.summary: India signed Terms of Reference for a potential FTA with Gulf Cooperation Council, aiming to boost trade, investment, and jobs. GCC includes Saudi Arabia, UAE, Oman, Qatar, Kuwait, Bahrain.

articles.title: Finance Commission hearings expose deep Centre–states rift over tax devolution, cess sharing
articles.summary: With most states arguing that rising cess and surcharge collections have eroded the shareable tax pool, the Finance Commission hearings have become a forum for deeper questions on fiscal autonomy, constitutional limits, and how India’s federal finances should be recalibrated amid mounting spending pressures.

articles.title: India says it will buy oil where it makes sense, keeps Venezuela option open
articles.summary: India says it remains open to buying crude from Venezuela as part of its energy diversification push, stressing market viability, sanctions compliance and long-term supply security.

articles.title: How global companies are quietly turning India into their second home
articles.summary: Global capability centres are reshaping India’s office market, jobs and capital flows, turning the country into a long-term hub for high-value global work and growth.

articles.title: India's US trade deal: Experts on how the import gap can be bridged
articles.summary: Experts said India’s trade gap with the US may be higher if services payments and spending by Indian students and firms are included. Energy imports such as LNG, LPG, and ethane are being seen as areas where India can increase US imports. However, supply limits and commercial pricing decisions will influence actual trade flows.

articles.title: Tanker Crash | Mumbai-Pune Expressway traffic chaos continues, tolls halted
articles.summary: Toll collection on Mumbai–Pune Expressway was suspended after a propylene gas tanker overturned near Adoshi tunnel yesterday (Feb 3) evening, causing a 12-hour traffic halt and major disruption in Raigad district.

articles.title: ‘Flooded with partnership requests’: Ambani on Reliance’s pull; Fink says India outpaces US in digitisation
articles.summary: Ambani was speaking to CNBC-TV18, sharing the stage with BlackRock chairman and CEO Larry Fink. The two are already partners—BlackRock, the world’s largest asset manager, and Jio launched a 50:50 joint venture in 2023 to build an asset management business in India

articles.title: India-US FTA: All the furore over inclusion of agriculture and dairy in the deal
articles.summary: India-US FTA announcement has sparked controversy as US officials flag zero tariffs on farm goods, Opposition and farmer unions protest, while government insists agriculture and dairy remain protected.

articles.title: RBI likely to stay on hold in February as trade deal improves macro comfort
articles.summary: Despite differing medium-term views, the Citizen MPC panel unanimously expects the RBI to keep the repo rate unchanged at the February 6 meeting, with Samiran Chakraborty indicating a dovish pause stance.

articles.title: On US India deal, Goyal says energy diversification paramount for India
articles.summary: Piyush Goyal stressed energy diversification and security for India, while US-India talks hint at expanding trade and reducing Russian oil reliance, but no formal commitments were announced.

articles.title: S&P Global-HSBC PMI: India’s services activity rebounds in January, jobs growth nearly flat
articles.summary: Rise in new export businesses helped push the growth with demands increasing from Indonesia, Qatar, Sri Lanka and Vietnam. As a result, the numbers expanded fastest since November.

articles.title: Budget 2026 | PSU bank mergers, capital rule changes on the table as India aims for bigger global banks: DFS Secretary
articles.summary: The Financial Services Secretary said the proposed Banking Committee for Viksit Bharat will have a wide mandate, including examining whether India’s regulatory capital framework needs greater flexibility and whether further public sector bank consolidation could help create globally competitive lenders.

articles.title: IRFC joins forces with Tuticorin port and Sagarmala Finance to boost big infrastructure projects
articles.summary: IRFC, VOCPA and SMFC signed an MoU to finance the Outer Harbour Development Project at Tuticorin Port, boosting multimodal infrastructure under Sagarmala and PM Gati Shakti plans.

articles.title: US Trade Representative Greer claims India agreed to zero tariffs on industrial goods
articles.summary: Speaking to CNBC International, US Trade Representative Jamieson Greer said India has agreed to cut tariffs on most industrial goods to zero and lower duties on a wide range of agricultural products.

articles.title: India-US tariff cut to 18% is a big step forward, but execution at home will decide gains: Meera Shankar
articles.summary: The sharp tariff rollback offers India a stronger footing against several emerging market competitors in the US, but former envoy Meera Shankar cautions that the real gains will depend on how quickly India tackles domestic cost and logistics hurdles to convert the lower duty into sustained export momentum.

articles.title: India-US trade deal lifts market mood, industry sees relief for key export sectors
articles.summary: Industry leaders Rajiv Memani, Amit Kalyani, Sanjay Budhia and Suvankar Sen welcome the India-US trade deal, citing tariff relief and improved export prospects.

articles.title: India-US Trade Deal | Dairy, agriculture protected, says Piyush Goyal
articles.summary: Piyush Goyal announced that India protected dairy and agriculture in the US-India trade deal, with tariffs cut to 18%, benefiting marine exporters, MSMEs, and technology sectors.

articles.title: FICCI leaders welcome India-US trade deal, say tariff cut lifts uncertainty and opens export opportunities
articles.summary: FICCI leaders said the sharp reduction in US tariffs on Indian goods could provide a major boost to export-oriented sectors, improve India’s competitiveness against rival economies, and strengthen long-term trade ties with the world’s largest consumer market, even as the fine print of the agreement is awaited.

articles.title: BEML to invest ₹1,500 crore in greenfield rail manufacturing facility in MP
articles.summary: BEML Limited will invest ₹1,500 crore to set up BRAHMA rail facility at Umariya near Bhopal. Despite Q3FY26 losses and falling shares, revenue rose 23.7 percent to ₹1,083 crore.

articles.title: Zero Russian oil unlikely despite India-US trade deal, indicates former HPCL chief
articles.summary: India and the US announced an interim trade agreement lowering tariffs on Indian exports to 18 percent, while India faces pressure to reduce Russian oil imports amid complex refinery dependencies.

articles.title: AI firm Fractal Analytics mops up ₹1,248 crore in anchor round; IPO opens February 9
articles.summary: Backed by heavyweight domestic mutual funds, insurers and global institutions, the AI and data analytics firm will open its ₹2,834-crore public issue next week, with proceeds earmarked for debt repayment, R D, expansion and strategic initiatives.

articles.title: DIPAM receives financial bids for IDBI Bank privatisation
articles.summary: DIPAM has confirmed receipt of financial bids for IDBI Bank, signalling renewed momentum in the long-running privatisation of the state-owned lender.

articles.title: NSE Q3 net profit up 15% QoQ on higher trading volumes and cost savings
articles.summary: National Stock Exchange of India Ltd (NSE) reported Q3FY26 consolidated total income of ₹4,395 crore, up from ₹4,160 crore in Q2FY26. Profit after tax rose 15% QoQ to ₹2,408 crore, supported by higher trading volumes in equity cash and derivatives segments and cost efficiencies.

articles.title: Mitsubishi Electric India to invest ₹2,100 crore in Chennai facility at Mahindra Origins
articles.summary: Mitsubishi Electric India inaugurated a ₹2,100 crore air-conditioner and compressor plant near Chennai, boosting localisation, manufacturing capacity and employment, while reinforcing Tamil Nadu’s position as a key electronics and industrial hub.

articles.title: Tata Chemicals to spend ₹515 crore on Tamil Nadu salt plant
articles.summary: Tata Chemicals will invest ₹515 crore to set up an IVSD salt plant in Tamil Nadu with 210 KTPA capacity, creating a second production base and improving supply to southern markets.

articles.title: Now smaller NBFCs are exempt from RBI registration: What this means for borrowers and businesses
articles.summary: RBI exempts NBFCs with assets up to ₹1,000 crore and no public funds from registration, boosting financial inclusion, say industry leaders.

articles.title: Exclusive: UPL, Coromandel among 4 firms in race for US-giant FMC's India biz
articles.summary: UPL, Dhanuka, Coromandel, and Crystal Crop may bid for FMC’s India unit, worth $450M, as FMC seeks to cut debt and refocus globally.

articles.title: Air India CEO defends airline’s safety systems after Boeing 787 fuel switch investigation
articles.summary: Air India CEO Campbell Wilson said the London Dreamliner episode underscores the strength of aviation safety protocols, with crew reporting, regulatory checks and precautionary inspections working as intended even as the UK regulator seeks further explanations.

articles.title: RBI NBFC reforms: No-registration rule for small NBFCs and relaxed housing loan norms for UCBs
articles.summary: The Reserve Bank of India announced reforms easing registration and branch rules for smaller NBFCs, with Governor Sanjay Malhotra stressing continued financial stability and robust sector resilience.

articles.title: RBI proposes collateral-free MSME loan cap hike to ₹20 lakh
articles.summary: RBI proposes raising collateral-free loan cap for MSMEs to ₹20 lakh, with repo rate unchanged at 5.25 percent. Liquidity measures aim to boost credit, growth, and employment, says Shashank Udupa.

articles.title: RBI to launch unified portal to streamline bank data management
articles.summary: RBI will launch a unified portal for lead bank scheme data, boost MSME loan cap to ₹20 lakh, and propose digital banking safety measures, aiming to improve transparency and financial inclusion.

articles.title: Government invites application for SAIL CMD post
articles.summary: Government headhunter PESB on Thursday invited applications for the post of Chairman and Managing Director (CMD) of Steel Authority of India Ltd (SAIL).

articles.title: Top stories: PM Modi in Rajya Sabha, stocks slide, RBI MPC tomorrow, HAL chief on fighter jet race & more
articles.summary: Top 10@10 — CNBC-TV18’s daily newsletter featuring the top 10 stories on markets, corporate updates, economic insights, and financial highlights — delivered at 10 pm

articles.title: Swiss watch brand Atlantic Watches plans to double India stores as demand for mid-priced luxury watches grows
articles.summary: After a strong first year in India, Swiss watchmaker Atlantic Watches is scaling up its retail presence, banking on rising demand for mid-priced luxury timepieces and India’s growing relevance in the global Swiss watch industry.

articles.title: Kotak Mahindra Bank says it has not submitted financial bid for IDBI Bank stake sale
articles.summary: Kotak Mahindra Bank denied submitting a financial bid for IDBI Bank, countering media reports. Bids were received from Fairfax Financial and Emirates NBD for the 60.7 percent stake sale.

articles.title: GST intelligence conducts search at Go Digit General Insurance; company says no material impact
articles.summary: DGGI Gurugram searched Go Digit General Insurance in February under GST Act. No adverse findings yet. Go Digit, Pune-based, is cooperating and sees no material impact on business.

articles.title: Zerodha rolls out Kite Terminal Mode in beta: How it changes the trading workspace
articles.summary: Zerodha launches Terminal Mode on Kite Beta 777, letting users customise trading layouts, access integrated tools, and save workspaces. Nithin Kamath invites feedback during the testing phase.

articles.title: India-US interim trade deal: Big gain for chemical stocks
articles.summary: The US accounts for 20% of India's annual chemical exports worth $60 billion. While the two sides have issued a joint statement, the trade deal has not been signed yet. The new tariff of 18% will be applicable only after the pact is signed officially.

articles.title: US to monitor India's crude oil imports from Russia
articles.summary: The US Secretary of State can bring back the 25% penalty tariff on India if deemed fit.

articles.title: India slips to fourth in MSCI EM Index weight as South Korea pulls ahead
articles.summary: India’s weight in the MSCI Emerging Markets Index has slipped to fourth as investors chase AI- and semiconductor-led rallies elsewhere, with foreign outflows and limited tech exposure weighing on domestic equities.

articles.title: Global markets may bleed, but India will win: Quant MF’s Sandeep Tandon explains why
articles.summary: Quant Mutual Fund Founder & CIO Sandeep Tandon says global market stress could redirect capital flows towards India, even as he flags selling exhaustion, a sharp portfolio shift towards private banks and insurance, and valuation risks in overheated sectors such as defence and global technology.

articles.title: NSE board approves IPO via OFS
articles.summary: The National Stock Exchange of India (NSE) on Friday announced that its governing board has formally approved plans to launch its long‑delayed initial public offering (IPO) through a pure Offer for Sale (OFS) by existing shareholders. The approval marks a major step forward in a listing journey that has stretched nearly a decade.

articles.title: Commodities cool off, but investors aren't calling the end of the rally yet: Elara Capital
articles.summary: Elara Capital says the commodity pullback looks like consolidation, not reversal, as fund flows stay supportive of de-dollarisation, emerging markets, and energy despite short-term volatility.

articles.title: SBI set for steady Q3 show as loan growth holds firm, profit growth stays muted
articles.summary: All eyes will be on SBI’s management commentary around loan growth momentum, asset quality trends and margin outlook, as investors assess the bank’s ability to sustain performance amid higher provisions and an unchanged interest rate environment.

articles.title: India’s forex reserves hit fresh record of $723.8 bn after $14.4 bn weekly surge
articles.summary: India's forex reserves hit a record $723.774 billion, driven by a $14.595 billion surge in gold reserves, while foreign currency assets dipped and SDRs and IMF position increased, says Reserve Bank.

articles.title: Sula Vineyards' profit slumps for fifth straight quarter as Karnataka destocking hits Q3
articles.summary: Net profit was down 67.5% year-on-year to ₹9.1 crore, compared with ₹28 crore in the same period last year.

articles.title: Amit Shah begins two-day Jammu & Kashmir visit to review security, inaugurate development works
articles.summary: Amit Shah’s packed itinerary in Jammu includes a ground-level security assessment along the International Border, rollout of welfare initiatives for border guards, and high-level meetings focused on counter-terror preparedness and the region’s development roadmap.

articles.title: Tamil Nadu Minister says North Indians 'clean tables,' sell 'pani puri'; BJP calls it 'reckless and dangerous'
articles.summary: Speaking at an event in Chengalpattu, Panneerselvam talked about people from North India working in low-paying jobs.

articles.title: Maharashtra council panel summons comedian Kunal Kamra over remarks against Deputy CM Eknath Shinde
articles.summary: Kamra and Andhare were initially asked to appear before the panel at 2 pm on February 5. However, after both of them expressed their inability to attend, the hearing has now been rescheduled to February 17, the committee chairperson and BJP MLC Prasad Lad told PTI on Wednesday.

articles.title: Centre ‘attempting to silence’ Rahul Gandhi: Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah
articles.summary: Stating that Rahul Gandhi raised legitimate questions on national security based on excerpts from 'Four Stars of Destiny', the book authored by Naravane, he said the book, originally slated for release in 2024, remains unpublished because it is "being withheld" by the Government of India.

articles.title: Karnataka excise 'scam': BJP MLAs mark overnight protest against 'ATM sarkar' with bhajans, sloganeering
articles.summary: The agitation, underway since Tuesday night, entered its second day with BJP legislators seen taking a morning walk inside the Assembly building.

articles.title: Who is Nemcha Kipgen, a Kuki leader likely to be Deputy CM of Manipur
articles.summary: She represents the Kangpokpi Assembly constituency and also previously helmed several ministries in the state government.

articles.title: Who is Yumnam Khemchand Singh, the BJP MLA set to be Manipur's next CM
articles.summary: BJP MLA Yumnam Khemchand Singh is set to become Manipur Chief Minister, bringing legislative experience and a rare martial arts distinction.

articles.title: BJP 'mastermind' behind Sunetra Pawar's appointment as deputy CM, claims Saamana
articles.summary: The Opposition Shiv Sena (UBT) on Monday claimed the BJP leadership was the "mastermind" behind NCP leader Sunetra Pawar taking oath as Maharashtra deputy chief minister, just days after her husband Ajit Pawar's demise.

articles.title: National Statistics Office proposes migration survey in July 2026: All you need to know

articles.summary: JSW MG Motor India said its Majestor SUV climbed Mount Japfü in Nagaland during testing, as the company prepares to unveil what it calls India’s first D+ segment SUV on 12 February.

articles.summary: The Supreme Court said that the central issue was the right of the minor to decide whether to continue the pregnancy. The Bench noted that the pregnancy was, on its face, “illegitimate” as the girl herself was a minor and was facing the situation as a result of an unfortunate relationship.

As countries build their own AI ecosystems, India’s push for sovereignty through local data, domestic model-building, and semiconductor manufacturing could determine its place in the future AI order.

From transforming education and healthcare to boosting productivity, AI could redefine India’s economic standing over the next two decades.

Leaders argued the deal is heavily tilted towards the US and will negatively impact farmers, highlighting a lack of transparency in the agreement's details.

articles.title: US deal boosts India's growth engine: Amit Shah
articles.summary: India and the United States have reached an interim trade agreement. This deal is expected to boost India's economic growth and manufacturing sector. Government leaders stated that the agreement safeguards the nation's core interests. It aims to create more jobs and opportunities for farmers, entrepreneurs, and businesses across the country.

articles.title: 'Politically motivated': Sonia Gandhi slams plea over 1980 voter list inclusion
articles.summary: Sonia Gandhi Saturday termed a criminal revision petition against a magisterial order as "politically motivated and frivolous." The petition alleges her name was included in electoral rolls in 1980 using forged documents, despite her acquiring Indian citizenship later. Gandhi argued citizenship and electoral roll issues fall outside criminal court jurisdiction.

articles.title: Tamil literature is eternal and its culture global, PM Modi says in Malaysia
articles.summary: Prime Minister Modi lauded Tamil culture at a Kuala Lumpur event, highlighting its global reach and the significant presence of Tamilians in India's leadership. He announced UPI's upcoming availability in Malaysia and the opening of India's first consulate there, strengthening bilateral ties and community outreach. Modi also pledged a new Thiruvalluvar Centre to honor shared heritage.

articles.title: Govt spent barely 40% of Budget on biggest schemes in 9 months
articles.summary: Government spending on major schemes lags significantly, with only 41.2% of the budgeted amount disbursed in the first nine months. Revised estimates for 47 out of 53 large projects are lower than initially planned. Several key initiatives, including the Jal Jeevan Mission, show drastically reduced spending, raising concerns about project execution and fund utilization.

articles.title: India, US discuss ways to boost collaboration in critical, emerging defence tech
articles.summary: India and the US convened in New Delhi to bolster cooperation in cutting-edge defence technologies. The 24th Indo-US Joint Technical Group Plenary Meeting focused on enhancing joint research and development, involving universities, labs, and industries. Discussions aimed to address evolving defence needs and explore new collaborative avenues, culminating in a project agreement.

articles.title: Over 1.7 crore tourists, including 36,000 foreigners, visited J&K in 2025: Govt
articles.summary: Jammu Kashmir welcomed over 1.7 crore tourists in 2025, including more than 36,000 international visitors. While no specific targets are set for 2026, the government is actively working to boost tourist numbers through various initiatives. The Home Stay program has proven successful and is slated for expansion, despite facing challenges like awareness and infrastructure gaps.

articles.title: Amit Shah review progress of development projects, reaffirms Modi govt’s commitment to building prosperous J&K
articles.summary: Union home minister Amit Shah reviewed Jammu and Kashmir's development projects. He also stressed hydropower potential and welfare scheme saturation. Aggressive tourism marketing and sports infrastructure development were highlighted. The region will receive 50-year interest-free loans for capital projects. The government aims for a developed Jammu and Kashmir by 2047.

articles.title: BJP mocks NC’s ‘special status’ call for J&K, says no return of Article 370
articles.summary: BJP leader Sunil Sharma challenged the National Conference's demand for Jammu and Kashmir's "special status," stating the term is not in the Indian Constitution. Sunil Sharma argued that Article 370, which NC claims defined this status, has been "buried," dismissing the demand as baseless and accusing NC of misleading voters.

articles.title: Government e-Marketplace upgrading its portal to make it future-ready: CEO
India offers limited access to agri goods; protects staples, dairy
articles.summary: India and the US have finalized the first phase of a trade deal, leading to reduced reciprocal tariffs on Indian exports to 18%. This move benefits labor-intensive sectors like textiles and leather, while India has carefully opened up to American imports, protecting sensitive agricultural and dairy products. Several Indian food items will also gain zero-duty access to the US market.

articles.title: After year of turmoil, Indian diamonds and gems set to shine in US markets
articles.summary: India and the US have agreed to an interim trade framework granting zero-duty access for diamonds and colored gemstones. This move is seen as a critical inflection point for the Indian gems and jewellery sector, aiming to reverse a significant decline in exports to the US market and restore competitiveness.

articles.title: India-US trade deal: Interim pact brings 'certainty and clarity' for pharma sector
articles.summary: An interim India-US trade arrangement offers clarity to India's pharma sector, keeping medicines out of reciprocal tariffs. Washington has signaled negotiated outcomes for generics under the Section 232 investigation, which examines imports for national security threats. This agreement is seen as reassuring for strengthening the partnership and ensuring medicine security.

articles.title: Trade deal: Aviation suppliers eye greater access to US
articles.summary: A landmark Indo-US trade deal is poised to significantly boost India's aerospace exports, potentially doubling sourcing for giants like Boeing. Zero-duty access for components will place India on par with established aerospace supply chains, with Indian carriers expected to place substantial aircraft orders.

articles.title: India, US signal intent to counter China's economic dominance
articles.summary: India and the US are strengthening economic security alignment to enhance supply chain resilience and innovation, addressing non-market policies of third parties. This move signals a synchronized strategy to reduce China's global manufacturing dominance in key sectors like semiconductors and green energy, building on previous commitments.

articles.title: India-US trade deal: Harley, Tesla to benefit, but no risk to desi firms
articles.summary: US auto giants Harley Davidson, Jeep, and Tesla are poised to benefit from a new trade deal with India. The agreement offers reduced import duties on specific high-engine capacity motorcycles and cars, with concessions for Harley Davidson's 800-1,600cc bikes and a phased duty reduction for vehicles over 3,000cc, potentially boosting Tesla and Jeep's market presence without impacting domestic manufacturers.

articles.title: The $500 billion question: What will India import?
articles.summary: India aims to import $500 billion in US goods over five years, but success hinges on American suppliers meeting demand. While oil and coal imports are set to rise, high-tech items like chips and aircraft face supply chain challenges. Indian buyers and US sellers must collaborate to achieve this ambitious trade target.

articles.title: Farmers question import of animal feed, soybean oil
articles.summary: India's decision to import animal feed like DDGs and soybean oil from the US has sparked farmer concerns, who fear the products originate from genetically modified crops. While the government assures that all domestic crops remain safe and GM traces are eliminated post-processing, farm organizations are seeking greater clarity on the agreement's implications for local agriculture and farmer incomes.

articles.title: India stands its ground on dairy, agri products
articles.summary: India has reached a trade agreement with the US on agricultural products. Tariffs will be reduced on several American food items like tree nuts and fruits. However, India will maintain protection for its dairy and genetically modified crops. This deal aims to balance trade interests for both nations, opening new avenues for Indian exports.

articles.title: Why it works for both sides: Relief for exports, choices for agriculture
articles.summary: A US-India joint statement signals a potential trade deal, with the US set to significantly drop import duties on Indian goods. This move is expected to boost India's labor-intensive sectors, while India will reduce tariffs on US agricultural products and industrial goods, fostering mutual benefit.

articles.title: Govt rolls out draft rules to simplify income tax filing
articles.summary: The income tax department has released draft rules aimed at simplifying tax filing and compliance for individuals and companies, effective April 1. These rules emphasize faceless assessments and reduced disputes, with simplified language and redesigned forms for easier taxpayer understanding. The draft is open for public feedback until February 22.
